intro: Nivenia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly nivenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
